channel.title: Herald-Tribune (Custom RSS - Broad Article Grab)
channel.description: A personal RSS feed with broader article scraping from heraldtribune.com

item.title: Roth shock: How a hasty conversion can cost Florida retirees thousands
item.description: Imagine you’re retired in Florida, relying on Social Security and a modest nest egg. You read about Roth conversions – moving taxable IRA funds into a tax-free Roth – and think, “Smart idea.” But that move could end up costing you more in taxes and Medicare premiums than you’d expect. Those so-called “senior benefits” from the IRS barely make a dent.

item.title: Manatee Memorial Hospital appoints new chief nursing officer
item.description: Judy Youngwas recently appointed as the new chief nursing officer atManatee Memorial Hospital, reporting to CEOAndy Guz.

item.title: Marni's sentimental guide to giving the past a presence in our homes
item.description: Over the years, I have earned the reputation as the stuff police. I am forever nagging you to purge, declutter, toss, donate, edit, dump, oust, clear, lighten up and let go. But today, sit down, I am going to sentimentally suggest that some old things you should keep.

item.title: Walking the rightsizing walk, part 2: How I stopped hyperventilating
item.description: Now that my husband, DC, and I had sold the Happier Yellow House to the first buyer who saw it, we were quite suddenly, technically, homeless. Yeep! My head was literally spinning. I need to sit down often and put my head between my knees.

item.title: Football recruiting: Which out-of-state programs are raiding Florida?
item.description: It's no secret that Florida is ahotbed for recruiting talent.

item.title: Bowl projections: Expect playoff surprises in unpredictable season
item.description: Forecasting the future can be intimidating when the world is chaotic and uncertain. Thankfully, making successful college football bowl predictions aren't as important as some of the biggest issues in the world.

item.title: State's power schools need QBs to stay healthy, lead to break playoff drought
item.description: Just when it appears the state ofFloridais ready to once again become relevant in the world ofcollege football, the football gods always find a way to start frowning on the Sunshine State.

item.title: Google rolls out ‘preferred sources’ feature. How to add Sarasota Herald-Tribune
item.description: Want to see more of the sites you love? Google’s got you covered.

item.title: Two-Minute Drill: Find out what happened between Jaguars…
item.description: The NFL preseason is over. Next stop: Week 1 after Labor Day. Here's what happened on the final weekend forFlorida's NFL teams.

item.title: Florida Lottery Cash4Life, Fantasy 5 results for Aug. 24…
item.description: TheFlorida Lotteryoffers several draw games for those hoping to win one of the available jackpots. Here’s a look at the winning numbers for games played on Sunday, Aug. 24, 2025

item.title: What does boat ownership have to do with investment…
item.description: There’s something about being on the water that can’t quite be replicated on land. The rhythm of the waves, the wind on your face, the hum of a well-tuned motor – whether you’re chasing a tide, fishing a flat, or just anchored off a sandbar for the day, boating offers a kind of therapy you can’t buy at any pharmacy. But make no mistake: boating is not an investment and strains the financial plan.

item.title: Art Center Sarasota celebrates 100 years of making art accessible
item.description: Raised in Sarasota by a single mother, Katherine Ceaser’s first encounters with fine art came on school field trips. As a girl, she wandered museums and galleries with her class, drawn to bursts of color and form that suggested other possibilities.

item.title: Sarasota County faces $38M future deficit as sheriff's budget soars
item.description: Sarasota County commissioners signaled they were unhappy with the size of the sheriff’s budget request this year at abudget meetingwhere they forecast storm clouds on the fiscal horizon.

item.title: Karen Rose returns to Sarasota School Board by DeSantis appointment
item.description: Karen Rose returns to Sarasota School Board by DeSantis appointment

item.title: Popular downtown Sarasota restaurant moving to a new location — and getting a new name
item.description: A fixture of downtown Sarasota's dining and drinking scene formore than a decade nowwill soon have a new location — and a new name.
